name: Path
doc:
Constructs an object that, for convenience, represents
a given path and provides a set of chainable methods
on that path.

children.name: valueOf

returns.doc: a string representation of the path.

children.doc: Permits a Path to be implicitly coerced into a String.

children.name: join

returns.doc: the path arrived at by following the given directories and file name.

children.doc: Joins paths onto this one.

children.name: resolve

returns.doc: the path arrived by following the given directory or file names, as distinguished by whether they have a terminal slash.

children.doc: Resolves locations based on this path.

children.name: to

returns.doc: the relative path from here to the given path.

children.doc: Returns the relative path from here to the given path.

children.name: from

returns.doc: the relative path from the given path to here.

children.doc: Returns the relative path from the given path to here.

children.name: glob

returns.doc: an array of paths for a shell expansion in the context of this path.

children.doc: Returns an array of paths for a shell expansion in the context of this path.

children.name: globPaths

returns.doc: an array of paths for a shell expansion in the context of this path, as Path objects.

children.doc: Returns an array of paths for a shell expansion in the context of this path, as Path objects.

children.name: absolute

returns.doc: the fully qualified path, as joined from the current working directory and normalized, but not canonicalized.

children.doc: Returns the fully qualified path, as joined from the current working directory and normalized, but not canonicalized.

children.name: canonical

returns.doc: the canonical path.

children.doc: Returns the canonical path.

children.name: directory

returns.doc: the directory containing this path, the parent directory.

children.doc: Returns the directory containing this path, the parent directory.

children.name: normal

returns.doc: this path in normal form, having removed every self `"."` entry and resolving all possible * parent `".."` entries.

children.doc: Returns this path in normal form, having removed every self `"."` entry and resolving all possible * parent `".."` entries.

children.name: listPaths

returns.doc: an array of path obejcts for each entry in the directory at this path.

children.doc: Returns an array of path obejcts for each entry in the directory at this path.

children.name: listTreePaths

returns.doc: an array of path objects for each entry in this directory, recursively traversing contained directories but not symbolic links, relative to this path.

children.doc: Returns an array of path objects for each entry in this directory, recursively traversing contained directories but not symbolic links, relative to this path.

children.name: base

returns.doc: the name of the directory entry for this path, without the extension if one is given and matches the entry.

children.doc: Returns the name of the directory entry for this path, without the extension if one is given and matches the entry.

children.name: changeGroup
children.doc: Changes the group ownership of the path.

children.name: changeOwner
children.doc: Changes the owner of the path.

children.name: copy
children.doc: Copies this path to the given target path.

children.name: copyTree
children.doc: Recursively copies this path to the given taget path.

children.name: exists

returns.doc: whether a file exists at this path.

children.doc: Returns whether a file exists at this path.

children.name: extension

returns.doc: the extension of this path.

children.doc: Returns the extension of this path.

children.name: hardLink
children.doc:
Creates another hard link to the file at this path
at the given path.

children.name: isDirectory

returns.doc: whether a directory exists at this path.

children.doc: Returns whether a directory exists at this path.

children.name: isFile

returns.doc: whether a regular file exists at this path.

children.doc: Returns whether a regular file exists at this path.

children.name: isLink

returns.doc: whether a symbolic link exists at this path.

children.doc: Returns whether a symbolic link exists at this path.

children.name: isReadable

returns.doc: whether the given path is readable to this user.

children.doc:
Returns whether the given path is readable to this user.

/!\ WARNING: this method should only be used to provide expedient
information to the user about whether the file is readable; the
only reliable way to ascertain whether a file is readable is to 
try to open it for reading.

children.name: isWritable

returns.doc: whether this path is writable to this user.

children.doc:
Returns whether the given path is writable to this user.

/!\ WARNING: this method should only be used to provide expedient
information to the user about whether the file is writable; the
only reliable way to ascertain whether a file is writable is to 
try to open it for writable.

children.name: list

returns.doc: a list of the directory entry names in this directory.

children.doc: Returns a list of the directory entry names in this directory.

children.name: listTree

returns.doc: a list of all paths under this directory, relative to this directory, including this directory as an empty string, `""`.

children.doc: Returns a list of all paths under this directory, relative to this directory, including this directory as an empty string, `""`.

children.name: makeDirectory

throws.doc: if the directory already exists, cannot be created,  or if the parent directory does not exist.

children.doc: Creates a directory at this path.

children.name: makeTree

throws.doc: if this directory or any of its parent directories cannot be created.

children.doc: Creates this directory and any parent directories as needed.

children.name: move
children.doc: Moves the file at this path to the target path.

children.name: lastModified

returns.doc: the date of the last modification of this file.

children.doc: Returns the date of the last modification of this file.

children.name: open

returns.doc: an open stream for a file at this path.

children.doc: Returns an open stream for a file at this path.

children.name: read

returns.doc: the content of the file at this path.

children.doc: Returns the content of the file at this path.

children.name: remove
children.doc: Removes the file at this path.

children.name: removeDirectory
children.doc: Removes the directory at this path.

children.name: removeTree
children.doc:
Removes this file or directory, and the content of this directory
recursively, not following symbolic links.

children.name: rename

params.name: name
params.doc: new file name, not a path.

children.doc: Renames the file at this path, relative to its parent directory.

children.name: size

returns.doc: the size of the file at this path.

children.doc: Returns the size of the file at this path.

children.name: split

returns.doc: an array of the the path components of this path, starting with the root of the file system if absolute.

children.doc: Returns an array of the the path components of this path, starting with the root of the file system if absolute.

children.name: stat

returns.doc: the file system metadata for the file at this path.

children.doc: Returns the file system metadata for the file at this path.

children.name: symbolicLink
children.doc: Creates a symbolic link to this path at the given target location.

children.name: touch
children.doc:
Sets the date of last modification for this path, creating
an empty file if necessary.

children.name: write
children.doc: Writes the given content to a file at this path.

returns.doc: an array of path objects for each entry in this directory, recursively traversing contained directories but not symbolic links, relative to this path.
